did.unittitle: Roy Lightner Collection of Antique Advertisements 1871-2009 and undated
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Roy Lightner was an advertising and marketing executive, primarily with N.W. Ayer & Son agency, from which he retired in 1980, and with Carden & Cherry Advertising of Nashville, Tenn. The Roy Lightner Collection of Antique Advertisements spans the years 1871-2009 and includes primarily print advertisements clipped from U.S. magazines. Also present are proofs of print advertisements and 16mm reels of television commercials, much of which was produced by the N.W. Ayer & Son agency during Lightner's career there. Advertisements predominantly focus on automobiles, railroads, insurance companies and manufacturers of brand name consumer goods. Over 300 companies are represented in the collection, including AT&T, Buick, Cadillac, Campbell's, Chevrolet, Chrysler, Coca-Cola, Dodge, Du Pont, Kodak, Ford, General Electric, General Mills, General Motors, Lincoln-Mercury, Metropolitan Life, Oldsmobile, Packard, Plymouth, Pontiac, RCA, and Studebaker.Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
In addition, original audiovisual materials are closed to patron use. Research Services staff need to produce use copies before contents can be accessed.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Roy Lightner Collection of Antique Advertisements, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Roy Lightner Collection of Antique Advertisements were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2002-2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions 2002-0299, 2003-0224, 2007-0208, 2009-0120 were merged into one collection, described in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note

chronitem.event: Graduated, Franklin & Marshall College, Lancaster, Pa.
Production Planner, Production Supervisor, N.W. Ayer Philadelphia
Vice President and Account Manager, N.W. Ayer Philadelphia
Retired from N.W. Ayer; assumed Directorship of United Methodist Church television ministry campaign
Vice President, Marketing Services, Carden & Cherry Advertising, Nashville, Tenn.
Oversaw production of "Ernest P. Worrell--Vern" commercials starring Jim Varney

bioghist.p: The following clients, represented in this collection, were served by Lightner during his tenure at N.W. Ayer: AT&T, Boeing, Breyer's, Cannon towels, Capehart, Carrier, Caterpillar, Chrysler, Clicquot Club, Container Corporation of America, DeBeers, Dole, Du Pont, Electric Companies, Forstman, French Line, General Electric, Goodyear, Hanes, Hess & Clark, Hires Root Beer, I.C.S., Insurance Companies of North America, Kellogg's, Maine Development Commission, Masonite, National Bible Week, National Dairy Products, New England Mutual, Nicholson File Co., N.W. Ayer, Oxirane, Penn Mutual, Plymouth, Red Heart Dog Food, Regal Shoes, Sani-Flush, Sealtest, Sergent's, Sheffield Farms, Steinway, Texaco, Times Mirror Magazine Network, TV Guide, U.S. Army Recruiting, Warren Telechron, and Yardley.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Roy Lightner Collection of Antique Advertisements spans the years 1871-2009 and includes primarily print advertisements clipped from U.S. magazines. Also present are proofs of print advertisements and 16mm reels of television commercials, much of which was produced by the N.W. Ayer & Son agency during Lightner's career there. Advertisements predominantly focus on automobiles, railroads, insurance companies and manufacturers of brand name consumer goods. Over 300 companies are represented in the collection, including AT&T, Buick, Cadillac, Campbell's, Chevrolet, Chrysler, Coca-Cola, Dodge, Du Pont, Kodak, Ford, General Electric, General Mills, General Motors, Lincoln-Mercury, Metropolitan Life, Oldsmobile, Packard, Plymouth, Pontiac, RCA, and Studebaker.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged in 6 series: General Goods and Services; Cars and Trucks; Norman Rockwell Collection; N.W. Ayer Materials; Roy Lightner Files; and Oversize Materials. General Goods and Services include all print advertisements except car and truck advertisements, arranged alphabetically by product or company name. Cars and Trucks include print advertisements for automobiles, personal and commercial trucks and some corporate advertising from automotive companies, arranged alphabetically by vehicle make. The Norman Rockwell Collection consists of a set of advertisements, magazine covers and other illustrations featuring artwork by Norman Rockwell, arranged chronologically. The N.W. Ayer Materials consists primarily printed materials by or about the N.W. Ayer agency, along with some television commercials produced for Du Pont. Roy Lightner Files include handwritten inventories of advertisements included in this collection along with some clippings and memorabilia relating to Lightner's career. Oversize Materials include large-format materials removed from other series and housed separately, arranged to mirror the rest of the collection.

scopecontent.p: Includes illustrations and print advertisements featuring artwork by Norman Rockwell. Advertisements include Crest toothpaste, Green Giant, Kellogg's, Massachusetts Mutual, Plymouth, Sharon Steel, Swiss watches, and Upjohn; covers for Saturday Evening Post, and artwork for Savings Bonds and other public service campaigns.

did.unittitle: N.W. Ayer & Sons Materials, 1894-1994 and undated

scopecontent.p: Includes print advertisements, commercial reels and printed materials that document some of the advertising work performed by the N.W. Ayer & Son agency. Arranged by format.

accessrestrict.p: Restrictions on Access: Original audiovisual materials are closed to research until use copies can be produced. Contact Research Services for more information.
